qas.question: What company invented the tantalum light filament?
In what year was the tantalum light filament invented?
What were the major advantages of the tantalum light filament?

answers.text: These lamps were more efficient than even graphitized carbon filaments and could operate at higher temperatures.

qas.question: Who purchased the rights to the tantalum light filament from Siemens?
When did GE cease production of the tantalum light filament?
Who developed the tantalum light filament in 1905?
What lamps were less efficient than even graphitized carbon filaments?
What had a higher resistivity than carbon?
Who bought the rights to use tantalum filaments and produce then in Canada in 1913?

plausible_answers.text: These lamps were more efficient than even graphitized carbon filaments and could operate at higher temperatures.

qas.question: What were the minor advantages of the tantalum light filament from Siemens?

context: In <a1_0>1902<a1_0/>, the <a0_0><b5_0>Siemens<b5_0/><a0_0/> company developed a <b6_0>tantalum lamp filament<b6_0/>. <a2_0><b9_0>These lamps were more efficient than even graphitized carbon filaments and could operate at higher temperatures.<b9_0/><a2_0/> Since <b7_0>tantalum metal<b7_0/> has a lower resistivity than carbon, the tantalum lamp filament was quite long and required multiple internal supports. The metal filament had the property of gradually shortening in use; the filaments were installed with large loops that tightened in use. This made lamps in use for several hundred hours quite fragile. Metal filaments had the property of breaking and re-welding, though this would usually decrease resistance and shorten the life of the filament. <a3_0><b8_0>General Electric<b8_0/><a3_0/> bought the rights to use tantalum filaments and produced them in the US until <a4_0>1913<a4_0/>.
